bioghist.p: Martha C. Johnson (d. 1988) was the manager of the Francis Scott Key Book Shop in Georgetown, Virginia, and was a partner in the literary agency Johnson and Thompson Authors' Representatives in Washington D.C.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Johnson's records from her time at the Johnson and Thompson agency and files from the Francis Scott Key Book Shop. Records from the Johnson and Thompson agency include correspondence with authors and publishers; manuscripts and galleys of books; clippings; a large scrapbook of publicity material for Carp's Washington, the first book placed by the Johnson and Thompson agency; financial records; and administrative documents, such as phone lists of authors and publishers and a register of royalty payments. Records from the book shop include customer orders, publicity materials about the shop, financial records, photographs of the store, authors, and customers, sales catalogs, and other ephemera.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
